intro: Lysanthe cytisifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved broom, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features slender, branching stems with small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are compound, consisting of multiple narrow leaflets, giving it a delicate appearance. Lysanthe cytisifolia is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
